sentence.Network_en: The new road will bisect the town.
sentence.Network_cn: 新马路将把城市分成两部分.

sentence.Network_en: We'll bisect his trail in sixty seconds. Look for the red paint!
sentence.Network_cn: 六十秒钟之后我们就会找到他的行踪, 注意找红油漆记号!

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from bi- 'two' + Latin sect- (from secare 'to cut')

entry.tran: 将…一分为二；把…分为两部分
entry.def: If something long and thin bisects an area or line, it divides the area or line in half.

example.ex: The main street bisects the town from end to end.
example.tran: 这条主干道把整个小镇一分为二。

means.word_mean: 1. cut in half or cut in two;

auth_sentence.content: The trains bisect the town, cutting affluent north from poorer and predominantly minority south.
auth_sentence.res_content: The trains bisect the town, cutting affluent north from poorer and predominantly minority south.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The trains bisect the town, cutting affluent north from poorer and predominantly minority south.

stems_affixes.word_buile: sect切,割+arian……的,有人的意思→把人群分开的→搞宗派的
section[[n.章节,部分;地区,部门,科;截面,剖面]]糠?al……的→adj.可组合的
dissect[v.解剖;详细研究]+ion表名词→n.解剖,切开
in进入+sect切,割→昆虫一节一节如被切开

stems_affixes.value_cn: 相交,交叉;道路交叉口,十字路口
stems_affixes.word_buile: intersect[v.横断]+ion表名词→n.相交,交叉;道路交叉口,十字路口

inter在……中间+sect切割 →在中间切→横断
